intro: Valeriana sibirica, commonly known as Siberian valerian, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pink or white flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are widely used in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana sibirica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and meadows.
